duck: 2010 Chebyshev: An asteroid from the asteroid belt

Chebyshev polynomials - In mathematics the Chebyshev polynomials, named after Pafnuty Chebyshev, are a sequence of orthogonal polynomials which are related to de Moivre's formula and which can be defined recursively.
Chebyshev filter - Chebyshev filters are analog or digital filters having a steeper roll-off and more passband ripple or stopband ripple than Butterworth filters.

cat: Full Members of the St Petersburg Academy of Sciences
Members of the French Academy of Sciences
Foreign Members of the Royal Society

Konstantin Posse |known_for = probability, statistics, mechanics, and analytical geometry |prizes = Demidov Prize (1849) |footnotes = }} 'Pafnuty Lvovich Chebyshev' (, ) ( – )[http://www.britannica.com/eb/article-9022729/Pafnuty-Lvovich- Chebyshev Pafnuty Lvovich Chebyshev - Britannica Online Encyclopedia] was a Russian mathematician. His name can be alternatively transliterated as Chebychev, Chebysheff, Chebyshov, Tchebychev or Tchebycheff, or Tschebyschev or Tschebyscheff (the latter two pairs are French and German transcriptions).
